sentences.english: Upon their marriage, the title Duke of Edinburgh was created for him.
sentences.chinese: 婚后，他被授予爱丁堡公爵的爵位。

sentences.english: King of Sweden hands each winner a  diploma and a  medal.
sentences.chinese: 由瑞士国王亲手将证书和奖章授予获奖者。

sentences.english: The frequency hit high for the first time in 1979.
sentences.chinese: 授予老朋友称号的频率在1979年达到顶峰。

sentences.english: The Golden Rooster Award is given out once a year.
The new laws empower the police to stop anybody in the street.
sentences.chinese: 新法令授予警方可在街上截停任何人的权力。

sentences.english: The contract contains options for additional payloads that would add to the initial award value.
sentences.chinese: 合同包含了可能会添加到最初授予价值的额外的载荷。

sentences.english: This international award has set the seal on a long and distinguished career.
sentences.chinese: 这项国际奖的授予是对一项长久而崇高的事业的肯定。

sentences.english: It will be given to a F.D.A. staff member annually.
sentences.chinese: 每一年它被将授予给一位食品药品管理局的员工。

sentences.english: The most common source is to be granted a monopoly by the government, either through patents, in which case the monopoly is temporary, or through a government franchise.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的是由政府授予的垄断，比如说专利或特许权。

sentences.english: The old king reposed too little power in the young chancellor.
sentences.chinese: 年老的国王授予这位年轻宰相的权力太小了。

sentences.english: For this function, he was awarded the Xuanwu Jiedushi title.
sentences.chinese: 这一职能，他被授予宣武节度使冠军。

sentences.english: The contract was awarded through the Network-Centric Solutions program.
sentences.chinese: 该合同是通过网络中心解决方案项目授予的。

sentences.english: XJTLU's Masters degrees are validated by the University of Liverpool (UK).
sentences.chinese: 合格毕业生将被授予英国利物浦大学硕士学位。

sentences.english: The agency has partnered with key colleges and universities to offer degree programs in this field.
sentences.chinese: 该学院部门与重点高校合作共同授予学生学位。

sentences.english: Ennoble a prime minister for distinguished service.
sentences.chinese: 因其杰出的功劳授予总理爵位。

definition: to elect as/to choose as/to consider as
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
